name: Golden Wings of Watercocks - Monthly Film Screenings
description:
In a lush haor, Sultan, a young man seeking a fresh start, becomes entwined in a poignant tale of resilience and sacrifice. He joins a family haunted by tragedy, where he toils amidst the golden fields, forming bonds that defy the encroaching monsoon's wrath. Yet, as floods ravage their world, tragedy strikes once more, thrusting Sultan into a whirlwind of responsibility and love. Amidst shattered dreams and fleeting hope, their journey unfolds—a gripping saga of courage and determination against nature's merciless onslaught. Join them on a riveting adventure as they chase elusive dreams and find solace in the wings of imagination.
Trailer: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Lo5TXkaGeALWiXIlVenMb0FFcHu2vmYs/view

name: Chapter Carnival 2.0 - Literary Meetup
description:
Atta Galatta and Your View On Books, A Novel Club cordially invite you to the latest Library Meetup in town.
Join us for a innovative Library Meet wherein there`s over hundreds of books and you could pick a book in random and start reading together.
Have an enriching evening of literary discussion and camaraderie at our Book Club Meet event! Engage in lively conversations, exchange recommendations, and bond over our mutual love for literature. Don`t miss out on this opportunity to connect with fellow book enthusiasts and expand your literary horizons!
Come along with Empty Minds and fill it with rich literature from Atta Galatta’s Reading Section.
What does it entail:
Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
Reading minimum one chapter from a random book that you choose from the libary.
Participating in the ensuing curated discussion.
Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
Listen more. Speak mindfully.
No monopolizing the conversation.

name: Junior Magic and Energy Clowning Workshop - Magic and Clowning Workshop
description:
Join us for a fun-filled family date: kids can learn magic tricks while adults dive into the art of clowning! Whether you’re with family, friends, or even if you’re alone, come along and make new friends!
Magic Workshop (Ages 6-12)
Let your kids shine with our Junior Magic Course! Designed to enhance creativity, storytelling, dexterity, stage presence, communication, and confidence through magic. Children will learn to perform magic tricks using everyday items found at home, enabling them to amaze wherever they go. This workshop empowers children with skills they can use anytime, anywhere. Conducted by Nikhil Raj illusionist, Bengaluru’s favorite magician who has been in the field or more than 15 years now.
Clowning Workshop (Ages 13-99)
Rediscover yourself through laughter with our Energy Clowning Workshop! Dive into a journey of playful action, speech, and thought exploration. This workshop creates a supportive environment for free expression, helping participants reconnect with their inner child and discover hidden strengths. Develop emotional intelligence for stress management and positive behavior through laughter and joy.
Workshop by Ronak Sharma who is a trainer and an author, has an experience in the field of arts for more than 12 years in theater and clowning. 
Event Highlight: 
Finale Show by participants where family surprise each other by putting up a surprise show
This event promises to be a memorable experience for all ages, fostering creativity, laughter, and family bonding.
Takeaway: Each child receives a magic kit to continue their magical journey at home.
Bonus: Techniques to relieve stress and embrace laughter addiction to the entire family

name: The Art Exchange - Meetup
description:
Welcome to The Art Exchange, a social/art event for everyone!
This event is for artists, non-artists and everyone in between
All materials provided, no minimum skill required, just bring yourself!
You’re a piece of art away from new connections.
All materials will be provided.

name: Creative Writing Kids Workshop - Writing Workshop for Children
description:
Does your child bring home entertaining stories about their day in school? Make up clever excuses for why they didn’t do their homework? Or ask you imaginative questions about dinosaurs, superheroes and outer space that you have no answers to?
If yes, your child might just be a born storyteller!
This Sunday, join us for a workshop that will help your kid/s present their innate creativity and original thinking onto paper.
The workshop will be conducted by an experienced writer who has her work published in Femina, Mid-Day, ScoopWhoop, and Fork Media Group, among other renowned content brands. She will share - in kid-friendly language - lessons from her childhood days that helped her develop a flair for creative expression and develop a unique writing style.

name: Harry Potter Book Discussion - Meetup
description:
For hard-core Potterheads age 12 and above!
Get into the minds of the characters, ferret out the intricacies of the plot - enter the wizarding world and share your thoughts and insights!
Will help if you have read all the Harry Potter books - this discussion will be based only on the books and not the movies.
The event is curated by Lahe Lahe Caravan and is being hosted at Atta Galatta.

name: Oil Painting Workshop - Art Workshop
description:
Come, join me for an oil painting workshop. If this is your first dabble with paints, this fun and interactive step by step session is sure to keep you entertained, and provide the guidance for a canvas of your own creation. All the necessary materials will be provided. The only thing that you’re expected to bring along is your enthusiasm and art vibes.
Art is an expression of the inner self and the world around us as we perceive it. Oil paints provide beautiful rich textures and add depth and substance to the subject.
The essence of this session is to get together and create artistic strokes that unite us in a bond of communal love and creativity.

name: Infinitely Polar Bear - Mindful Cinema
description:
"Two emotions fighting each other to have control of you. Fights never end well. But being mindful around people who struggle with this fight every day is possible. Being at two poles of emotions is a conflict, confusion, embarrassment, and much more. Let`s know more about it!"
Prevention begins when we generate awareness and have empathy towards the happenings of our surroundings as well. Shraddha decided to screen cinema from the world to bring in some awareness about various aspects of mental health. The screening of the film will be followed by a discussion on the subject.
On 18th August 2024, we will screen the movie "Infinitely Polar Bear". It is an English movie with English subtitles on the father-daughter relationship.
Director and Writer: Maya Forbes
Cast: Mark Ruffalo and Zoe Saldana
After the movie, there will be a facilitated discussion around "Bipolar Disorder."
Facilitator: Shraddha Modi, a psychologist and behavior therapist whose passion for mental health has motivated her to study and work in this field.

name: Perspective Drawing Secrets - Drawing Workshop
description:
Perspective Drawing for Everyone
Join us for a fun and exciting workshop called "Perspective Drawing for Everyone"! This event is perfect for all levels who want to learn how to turn 2D sketches into 3D.
Why It's Important:

Create Realistic Art: Learn how to make your drawings look real and three-dimensional. Imagine drawing a road that looks like it stretches far into the distance or a building that looks tall and grand. Perspective drawing makes your art pop off the page!
Boost Your Imagination: Perspective drawing helps you bring your creative ideas to life. Whether you're designing a cool cityscape or a fantasy world, understanding perspective will make your drawings more believable and exciting.
Impress Your Friends: Imagine showing your friends a drawing of a skateboard park that looks like you could step right into it! Learning perspective will make your artwork stand out and impress everyone who sees it.
Have Fun with Art: Most importantly, perspective drawing is fun! You'll get to experiment with different techniques, learn new skills, and enjoy creating amazing artwork.

Join us for "Perspective Drawing for Everyone" and discover the magic of making your drawings come to life!
What will be provided?

All the needed materials will be provided
Ste-by-step instructions to get acquainted with the concepts

Mentor

Raju Dyapur (worldofpaintings.com) has been teaching Fine Art and Vedic Mathematics for more than 6 years and conducting workshops in India since 2014. His experience in drawing/fine art comes from his learning in school and college and the training he got from private lessons in Russia.
His artworks are in private collections in UK, Middle East, USA, Canada, Russia and Singapore and conducted hundreds of workshops across the nation and abroad.
Raju Dyapur was selected as one of the artists for WTC The Hague Art Gallery, Netherlands

name: ColorFull: Exploring Self Through Art Therapy - Art Therapy
description:
“ColorFull” is an art therapy session designed to help you explore and express your inner world through creative exploration of themes like safety and comfort while engaging with fellow participants in collaborative artwork.
What to Expect:
Inclusive Environment: A safe and welcoming space for self-expression and reflection.
No Experience Needed: You don`t need to be an artist to participate. All you need is an open mind and a willingness to engage.
Art Supplies Provided: We’ll provide all the materials you need, including colors and paper sheets. Just bring yourself!
Creative Guidance: Guidance through the creative process with a focus on personal and collective exploration of common themes.
Supportive Group Engagement: Participants are treated as members of a supportive group, where we will be attuned to each other’s expressions and creations, exploring common insights, and fostering a respectful and empathetic environment for everyone’s experiences.
Goals:
To facilitate self-discovery and emotional release through creative expression.
To foster a sense of community and shared understanding among participants.
To create a collaborative artwork that reflects the group`s collective experiences and insights.
Whether you`re an experienced artist or a beginner, this session offers a unique opportunity to explore your inner self and connect with others through the powerful medium of art. Join us and discover the transformative potential of creativity!
About the Facilitator: Fizapreet is a trauma-informed, queer-affirmative counseling psychologist and expressive arts practitioner currently practicing in Indiranagar, Bangalore.

name: Our Bones In Your Throat - Poetry Reading and Performance
description:
Join us for a 1-hour poetry special by Megha Rao, author of Our Bones In Your Throat. Megha’s poems exploring abundant joy, grief, female rage, revival and life’s strange and beautiful ways, on stage.
After the event, the poet will sign copies of her new novel, Our Bones in Your Throat.

name: Food In Indian Literature - Monthly Book Club
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well.
So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us to begin a dialogue on “Food in Indian Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we will be reading our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.
August Read: Bhog Naivedya: Food Offerings to the Gods by Sujata Shukla Rajan
We assure you that you will relish every single bite!
The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available.
Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who to love to read and eat!

name: Don't Stop Acting 1.0 - Acting Workshop
description:
Atta Galatta and MWM MOVIES cordially invite you to the latest Acting Workshop in town. 
Join fellow aspiring actors and actresses for an inspiring session of learning acting through basics at our Writers Club Meet event in the cozy ambiance of the library cafe. Our Acting workshop is designed for aspiring artists who wish to explore the fundamentals of acting and develop their performance skills in a supportive and engaging environment. This immersive workshop offers participants a thorough grounding in acting techniques, character development, and scene work, providing them with the tools needed to bring authenticity and depth to their performances.
Who Should Attend?
This workshop is ideal for beginners with little to no acting experience, as well as intermediate actors looking to refresh their skills. It is also suitable for anyone interested in improving their public speaking and presentation abilities.
Workshop Objectives:
- To introduce participants to the basic principles of acting.
- To develop participants` abilities to create believable and compelling characters.
- To enhance participants` skills in scene study and script analysis.
- To build participants` confidence in performing in front of an audience.
Key Components involves learning theory and practicals of: 
- Acting Techniques
- Character Development and Analysis
- SCript Analysis and Interpretation
- Understanding Director`s Vision
- Conveying Emotions
- Physicality and Movement of Camera
- Improvization and Spontaneity
- Voice and Diction
- Working with Props and Costumes
- Rehearsals and Performances
What does it entail:
- Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
- Participating in workshop with enthusiasm.
- Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- No monopolizing the conversation.
Disclaimer on Event Coverage:
- Event highlights will be captured through photos and videos for showcasing the event in our social media accounts.
- All Event media will be shared with the participants upon request.

name: Keepsake: A Short Story Collection - Book Signing
description:
Join us for author Neha Gupta's book signing at Atta Galatta on 24th August, Saturday, at 3.30 PM, where she will be signing copies of her short story collection, Keepsake.
“Life gives us stories to tell!”
Old photographs, cherished letters, museums, flea markets and heirlooms. From the pressed flowers between the pages of a forgotten book to the humming of a vintage song, from nostalgic daydreams to soulful conversations, the art of keeping memories forever. Just like moments in life, some stories are light-hearted and some intense, each having a heart of its own. Keepsake is a beautiful collection of memories lived and remembered. 
Celebrating nostalgia and storytelling with a cup of tea and conversations.

name: Everything Sucks - Book Launch
description:
Kashish Asif, a popular Instagrammer, navigates life at 18, accompanied by her widowed father, and occasionally present older sister. As her witty reels earn her a large following, she falls into an online battle with Sameer, an aspiring cook and budding Instagrammer. But their playful conflict soon gets blown out of proportion through an error of judgement.
Then, unexpectedly, they meet in real life. And even more unexpectedly, sparks fly between them. When reality creeps in, and an unfortunate incident forces them to unplug from their phones, they will need to figure out how to deal with life and relationships away from the screens.
Is it possible to find a real friend (or someone more than a friend) in a world where reactions are staged, people pretend to date each other for the likes, and the only constant is that everything really, really sucks?
From the bestselling author of Asmara’s Summer, filmed as the popular web series Dil Dosti Dilemma, comes a pitch-perfect teenage drama about friendship, family, and finding love in unexpected places. Join us for the launch of this YA book at Atta Galatta on 24th August at 4 PM!

name: What I Call Home - Playback Theatre Performance
description:
Home can mean different things to each of us. For some it’s a city or town, for others it’s the memory of certain people, or events. To some, it’s an emotion while for some it is a dream. And for some, it could be something they have moved on from!
Come, let’s get together and share with each other; our real-stories of whatever we call ‘home’ and watch as these stories are brought alive by the actors, on-the-spot!
About Playback Theatre:
Magical, creative, thought-provoking, reflective, unscripted...just like life itself. A format of improvisational, interactive theatre where the actors use their creativity and skill, to present an engaging and sensitive retelling of the audience members’ story, on-the-spot.

name: Park - Play
description:
One park. Three men. Three Benches and yet not enough space for all.
Manav Kaul’s "Park" delves into the complicated relationship of humans with space. Who has the better right on the space? The ones who need it for convenience or the ones who have a history associated or the ones who actually occupy it now? Why are men ready to wage wars for a mere piece of land? Is it a matter of power, history, pride or just plain greed?
Through the lens of the park, Manav Kaul offers a commentary on the human condition, prompting the audience to reflect on their own lives and relationships.
Aavirbhaav Naatya Manch presents a play that takes place in a seemingly ordinary setting – a PARK – but transcends the mundane as it delves into the complexities of the characters’ lives.
Director - Avinash Jain & Vikash Kumar
Actors - Rahul Gome, Jayant Sethi, Yashodhar Upadhyay

name: Park - Play
description:
One park. Three men. Three Benches and yet not enough space for all.
Manav Kaul’s "Park" delves into the complicated relationship of humans with space. Who has the better right on the space? The ones who need it for convenience or the ones who have a history associated or the ones who actually occupy it now? Why are men ready to wage wars for a mere piece of land? Is it a matter of power, history, pride or just plain greed?
Through the lens of the park, Manav Kaul offers a commentary on the human condition, prompting the audience to reflect on their own lives and relationships.
Aavirbhaav Naatya Manch presents a play that takes place in a seemingly ordinary setting – a PARK – but transcends the mundane as it delves into the complexities of the characters’ lives.
Director - Avinash Jain & Vikash Kumar
Actors - Rahul Gome, Jayant Sethi, Yashodhar Upadhyay

name: Wandering Thoughts - Reflection Circle - Women's Support Group
description:
Atta Galatta and fallenphoenix2fly warmly invite you to our Women Support Group Meet, a safe and supportive gathering dedicated to providing emotional support and fostering a sense of community among women. Join us for an evening of connection, sharing, and mutual support in the comforting ambiance of our library café. This event is designed to create a judgment-free zone where women can be themselves and share their experiences openly.
Event Structure:
Introduction Session: Participants introduce themselves to the group.
Icebreaker Game: A fun and engaging game to help participants get familiar with each other.
Listening Session: Each participant is given the opportunity to share what they are going through. This segment emphasizes silent support, without offering advice, to create a safe and non-judgmental space.
Positive Action Segment: After the emotional sharing session, we engage in an uplifting activity to provide positive reinforcement and soothe the soul.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- Respect each other`s experiences and maintain confidentiality.
- Provide silent support and refrain from offering unsolicited advice.
- While one person is sharing their story, participants should refrain from interrupting. We will allow each person to share in turn, and if anyone wishes to respond or provide support, they will have their chance during their turn.

name: Returning Home - Workshop
description:
How do I break free from the deep-rooted conditioning of shame, self-doubt and self-judgment and embrace my authenticity? How do I align with my life`s essence and emerge as a whole?
If you find yourself grappling with these questions,
If you are someone finding it challenging to navigate through your emotions and aspire to lead a harmonious life.
Or a curious explorer willing to discover the mysteries of our bodies. We invite you to join the Audacious Circle where we dive deep into understanding life essence, the concept of audacious love and return to our bodies.
The Audacious Circle is an initiative by Yashika CG, an educator, author and yoga practitioner who is on a forever journey into the great unknown.

name: Pen & Latte 4.0 - Story Writing Workshop
description:
Atta Galatta and Aristotle’s Writers Club cordially invite you to the latest Writers Meetup in town.
Join fellow wordsmiths and storytellers for an inspiring afternoon of creativity at our Writers Club Meet event in the cozy ambiance of the library cafe. Whether you`re a seasoned author, aspiring novelist, or just passionate about penning your thoughts, this gathering is your opportunity to connect with like-minded individuals. Unleash your creativity and let your words flow in the company of kindred spirits at our Writers Club Meet.
Bring along your notebook, laptop or tablet and delve into a shared writing experience.
What does it entail:
Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
Writing a story based on a prompt.
Participating in the curated feedback discussion.
Following community guidelines
Community Guidelines:
Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
Listen more. Speak mindfully.
No monopolizing the conversation.

name: Screen Craft 2.0 - Screenplay Writing Workshop
description:
Atta Galatta and MWM MOVIES cordially invite you to the latest Screenplay Writing Workshop in town. 
Our Screenplay Writing workshop is an intensive program designed to guide aspiring screenwriters through the process of crafting compelling and marketable screenplays. This workshop provides participants with a solid foundation in screenplay structure, character development, dialogue writing, and industry-standard formatting, ensuring they are equipped to bring their stories to life on the big screen.
Who Should Attend?
This workshop is ideal for beginners with little to no screenwriting experience, as well as intermediate writers looking to refine their skills. It is also suitable for novelists, playwrights, or anyone interested in exploring the craft of screenwriting.
Workshop Objectives:
- To introduce participants to the fundamentals of screenplay writing.
- To develop participants` skills in creating engaging plots and well-rounded characters.
- To enhance participants` abilities to write effective dialogue and visual storytelling.
- To familiarize participants with the screenplay industry and submission processes.
Key Components involves learning theory and practicals of: 
- Story and Character Development
- Screenplay Structure
- Dialogue Writing
- Scene Construction
- Visual Storytelling
- Formatting and Style
What does it entail:
- Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
- Writing a story based on a prompt.
- Participating in the curated feedback discussion.
- Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
- Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
- Listen more. Speak mindfully.
- No monopolizing the conversation.
Disclaimer on Event Coverage:
- Event highlights will be captured through photos and videos for showcasing the event in our social media accounts.
- All Event media will be shared with the participants upon request.

name: Chapters Unsealed 4.0 - Book Club
description:
Atta Galatta and Your View on Books cordially invite you to the latest Bibliophile Meetup in town.
Join us for an enriching evening of literary discussion and camaraderie at our Book Club Meet event! Whether you`re a seasoned bibliophile or just discovering the joy of reading, all are welcome to share their insights, opinions, and favorite passages. Engage in lively conversations, exchange recommendations, and bond over our mutual love for literature. Don`t miss out on this opportunity to connect with fellow book enthusiasts and expand your literary horizons!
Bring along your favorite book and delve into a shared reading experience.
 
What does it entail:
Involving in an ice breaker extravagant game.
Sharing your views on favorite books.
Participating in the curated discussion.
Voting for a Monthly Book Read.
Following community guidelines.
Community Guidelines:
Be open, be civil, be courteous, be kind, and have fun.
Listen more. Speak mindfully.
No monopolising the conversation.

name: Ranis of India - Storytelling
description:
Ranis of India is a collection of stories from various oral, folk, mythical and historical narratives collected based on numerous travel and research over the last few years on the lesser-known or completely forgotten women rulers of this wonderful country by Vikram Sridhar.
Over one hour, through oral story-telling smattered with folk songs, we travel the country, going deeper into many stories of Indian queens from myths, history and present times, whose stories need to be told and heard.
From North to South, East to West there have been women rulers, administrators, changemakers who’ve changed and touched history strongly.

name: A Story Walk Through Indiranagar - Story Walk
description: On a Sunday morning, walk through the lanes of INDIRA NAGAR with Vikram Sridhar discovering the lanes through the Folklore, Heritage and Ecology of the area. The walk will begin and culminate at ATTA GALATTA. The tales will revolve around historical, mythical and personal narratives weaved as we discover the area through the walk.

name: Ranis of India - Storytelling
description:
Ranis of India is a collection of stories from various oral, folk, mythical and historical narratives collected based on numerous travel and research over the last few years on the lesser-known or completely forgotten women rulers of this wonderful country by Vikram Sridhar.
Over one hour, through oral story-telling smattered with folk songs, we travel the country, going deeper into many stories of Indian queens from myths, history and present times, whose stories need to be told and heard.
